summary: Nancy P. Schultz was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list her name, position, salary, and employment dates within the SCAS. The consistent appearance of her name across these payroll documents indicates her involvement in the committee's operations during that period.
significance: Nancy P. Schultz's significance lies in her employment within the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the specific nature of her role isn't detailed in the provided documents, her presence on payroll and certification reports confirms her involvement in the committee's activities during its investigation.
